factors_favoring_stability: pH 3-6
factors_disfavoring_stability: Disordered secondary structure, high conformational flexibility and solvent accessibility, carboxylate buffers: phosphate, bicarbonate, tris
comments: Deamidation rate strongly depends on the i+1 residue: very high risk for NG; high risk for NH, NS, NT, NA; lower risk for bulky and hydrophobic residues (e.g. NI, NV, NL, NW, NP, etc.)
references: N. E. Robinson et al. 2004; N. E. Robinson and Robinson 2004; Wakankar and Borchardt 2006

factors_disfavoring_stability: Disordered secondary structure, high conformational flexibility and solvent accessibility, carboxylate buffers: phosphate, bicarbonate, tris

references: N. E. Robinson et al. 2004; N. E. Robinson and Robinson 2004; Wakankar and Borchardt 2006
